Here's what we know about Russian military capabilities in Syria:

MISSILES

'TRIUMPH' S-400 SURFACE-TO-AIR MISSILES

An advanced truck-mounted system that Russia is known to have deployed to protect its Hmeymim air base in Syria's Latakia Province and its Tartus naval facility on the coast.

Valery Gerasimov, head of Russia's General Staff, warned in March against any U.S. strike on the government quarter in Damascus where he said Russian military advisers, Russian military police and Russian ceasefire monitors were based.

SYRIAN AIR DEFENCES

Syria is known to have a mixture of Russian-made anti-aircraft systems, including the Pantsir S-1 and the Buk M2 surface-to-air missile system designed to shoot down cruise missiles, aircraft and drones.

BASTION COASTAL MISSILE DEFENCE SYSTEM

The Bastion system, thought to be deployed at or near Russia's Tartus naval facility, is an advanced mobile anti-ship and surface-to-surface defence system armed with two missiles.

MILITARY AIRCRAFT

Russia is estimated to have dozens of war planes and helicopters at its Hmeymim air base in Syria's Latakia Province including fighters, bombers and multi-role aircraft.
Moscow is able to mobilize powerful long-range strategic bombers from Russia itself to carry out bombing runs and has also fired cruise missiles in the past from ships in the Caspian Sea.

Capable of intercepting U.S. Tomahawk cruise missiles, there are question marks over whether Moscow has enough interceptor missiles deployed to Syria to handle a large swarm of missiles.

PANTSIR-S1

A truck-mounted short to medium range surface-to-air missile and anti-aircraft artillery weapons system possessed by both Russian and Syrian government forces in Syria.

PRECEDENT
